reviewText: My son loves the Wiggles and watches them every day on Disney. So I bought him this DVD.  Being that he had never heard the songs before he wasnt too impressed.  It took a few weeks for him to like it.  Over all - if your child loves the Wiggles and you as a parent are looking for a good, wholesome, educational movie for your child - the Wiggles are the way to go.  I have watched one too many comedies that have hidden violence and adult undertones that my son does not understand YET - but I DO!!  I have watched many an hour of their shows and the Wiggles are great!

reviewText: This is a great movie.  Love that the Wiggles incorporated some fun tunes with lots of animal education.  My two year old can name all the animals he sees on this video and knows all the dance moves.  The only negative I can say is that the Butterfly song is a bit slow and long, but otherwise the movie is fun and educational.  We really love it.  I recommend!

reviewText: The Wiggles & their friends join Steve Irwin, his wife Terri and their daughter, Bindi for lots of exciting animal adventures at the Australia Zoo.  Captain Feathersword learns how to speak cockatoo from "The Croccodile Hunter", Wags the Dog does the "Dingo Tango", and Dorothy dances the butterfly ballet with young girls in "Butterflies Flit".  The Wiggles: Wiggly Safari was my first Wiggles DVD that was first ever made in (2002).

reviewText: My 5 y/o loves dancing, my 2 y/o loves animals, I like the live show format (opposed to the computer generated studio background) and this DVD is a perfect blend of all three. Thanks to the enthusiastic Steve Irwin, I also find this to be one of the more educational Wiggles DVD we own and of course lots of catchy songs. All in all, a great addition to our Wiggles DVD collection.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Well, I think we have just about all of the Wiggle's videos and this one is just so very cute.  The DVD has an interview with them and Steve Irwin at the end and it really added to the video.  If you're expecting the same studio version, this isn't it.  The only disappointment was that they didn't use a live emu and I really wanted to see one!  Captain Feathersword is as goofy as ever, the man is so incredibly talented he should win some sort of award!  It's hysterical watching the scene with him in the bathtub.  These guys have every man's dream job - getting paid a whole lot to act like nuts but hey, it's wonderful what they're doing and the educational value is outstanding.  I've learned more about other cultures since we've been watching the Wiggles than I've ever known before.  Don't hesitate on this one - the "Snakes, you'd better not touch" song is worth the price of the DVD by itself.  Golly, is that funny!  Greg even gives us a couple of Elvis moves!  Pretty good and very entertaining to toddlers.  These guys put out a bunch of stuff and spend a ton of time away from their families to do it - to educate kids and they deserve all the credit and accolades that they've been receiving.  At least with them, you don't have to worry about screening the video before you put it in.  You don't have to worry about the pirate, even being in a wetsuit, ever seeing something that you shouldn't.  They think of everything and for that I'm greatly appreciative.  Now, too bad they can't take over the Thomas the Train series so that THEY'RE watchable!
summary: A Great Educational Experience and Entertaining
Title: N/A

reviewText: I truely think that Wiggly Safari which was made in (2002) just like Wiggle Bay around the exact same year, is such a groovy, wiggy action-fun movie.  Steve Irwin and his family got their own turn to work with Greg, Murray, Anthony, Jeff, & friends, Wags the Dog, Henry the Octopus, Dorothy the Dinosaur and Captain Feathersword the Friendly Pirate.  But what I love most about this DVD, is that the Captain learned how to speak cockato.
summary: Swing Into Action with the Wiggles!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I think this video sums up what the Wiggles are all about - singing fun songs for kids and having fun while they are doing it.  This video features Steve Irwin, the Crocodile Hunter as well as your Wiggle Favourites - Geoff, Murray, Anthony, Jeff, Captain Feathersword, Wags the Dog and Dorothy the Dinosaur.The Crocodile Hunter is a scream!  If you have ever seen him you know that his enthusiasm for life and animals is infectious.  A wonderful choice for the Wiggles to make a video with.Every song is about Australia wildlife and not only do you get to sing about it, you learn a little about the animal from the Crocodile Hunter and the Wiggles and you also get to see the animal in a very natural setting at Steve and Terri's Irwin's zoo (Australia Zoo, located on the Sunshine Coast, Queensland, Australia).I cannot recommend this video high enough, especially if your toddler is already a fan.  They'll learn alot about Australian animals and have fun doing the dance moves to each songs.  I have two girls - almost 3 and 18 months and they love this video!  They are huge Wiggles fans.You will not be disappointed.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a great Wiggles DVD! My kids love it, and there's a lot of novelty that keeps their interest even on repeated viewings. My kids like to make a game of telling which Wiggle they are (and which ones we are) depending on what color(s) are in their shirt that day, and now my boy has added Steve the Crocodile Hunter as one of the Wiggles he can be - it's probably cuter if you can see it, I suppose...
Title: N/A

reviewText: My daughter adores The Wiggles, and truth be told, I don't mind them myself.  I thought this video would be a way to get her six-year-old brother to join in the fun, given the presence of the Crocodile Hunter.  Unfortunately, it came up short for all of us.The production is strong, and the guys look like they're having a great time--they really do.  But their fun doesn't make the leap to the viewer, regardless of age.  Chief among the problems is that none of the songs is up to Wiggles par--not a single one sticks in your head.  And the pacing is awkward at times, with rough transitions between songs.Of all The Wiggles videos in my house, this one gets viewed the least.  Sad, because with its ingredients, it could have been really good.
summary: Something's missing in what could have been great fun

reviewText: My 17 month old really doesn't like this video very much even though it was the first we purchased.  Her dad calls it The Wiggles Meet Steve Erwin.  The songs are cute, but the video seems a little long to me and she doesn't usually watch but a few minutes of it.  As I limit her video time to when I fix dinner that means this video isn't very useful to me.  She has started watching more in the last few weeks, but still prefers the other videos more.

reviewText: Now the Wiggles are stranded in the bush, and who comes to their rescue but Steve Irwin, the Crocodile Hunter, and there begins the journey into the many facets of wildlife in Australia.  There are lots of kids and animals, and music, and many of the animals who are native to Australia are featured.  We even see the Wiggles on the animals themselves, as well as the whole Irwin family.The fun, music, dancing, and the Wiggles Car all make this a marvelous respite for the entire family!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: My toddler is a big Wiggles fan and this movie is his current favorite.  Contrary to some opinions, the songs are fantastic -- high energy and very catchy (just ask my husband and me, who have them stuck in our head constantly!).  My son is a huge animal lover, and this video combines his beloved Wiggles with live-action footage of real snakes and camels, to name just a couple.  I was never a big fan of Steve Irwin the Crocodile Hunter, but you have to admit, the guy has heart, and even he has grown on me.  All in all, this is a great film for animal-loving Wiggle fans.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I watch the Wiggly Safari each time I baby-sit my little niece and nephew.  Both of them (and frankly myself included) love this DVD.  The songs are nice and catchy (our favorites are The Crocodile Hunter, Australia Zoo, Dingo Tango, Snakes, Kookaburra Choir, and the list goes on).  The DVD does a great job introducing kids to many interesting Australian animals.  The fact that Wiggly Safari was mostly filmed at Australia Zoo and seeing Steve, Terri, and Bindi Irwin makes this DVD extra special.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have all The Wiggles tapes. This one is the funniest of them all. The Wiggles are located outside at the Australian Zoo the entire time. They play with Steve the Crocodile Hunter and dance and sing with him too. He adds humor to the show and introduces many animals from Cockatoos to Kangaroos. They do not show all the animals at the zoo, but they do show quite a few. My 26-month-old really likes this one. The songs are very good and fun! The dancing is non-existent since they no longer have a contract with the Donna Halloran School of Dance. Their new Chorographer is the old Dorothy the Dinosaur Leanne Ashley. She herself is a fabulous dancer, but as of yet, can't get The Wiggles or the children to dance. With the great outdoors, the fun songs about animals and the cute skits between The Wiggles and Steve Irwin, this is a smash hit! They really did seem to genuinely have a ball filming this one, and their enthusiasm and happiness pours through every second of the film making it very special and sure to make your toddler smile! Now if they can only get Leanne Halloran (Officer Peoples) back to do the Chorography they'd be perfect!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a good to very good Wiggles product with an emphasis on the music. It also provides educational material on the various Australian animals. Bpth the 4 and 2 year old granddaughters enjoy various segments. We had a videotape of this but chose to buy the DVD so that they could focus on the segments that they liked more readily if time was limited. The product does this well.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Out of the five Wiggles videos that we have, this is by far my 2-year old son's favorite.  It really has a winning combination of great songs, close up shots of animals, and, of course, Steve Irwin, the Crocodile Hunter!This is also the one Wiggles DVD that I will choose if my son is hankering for a Wiggles fix.  It's the only one that doesn't drive me crazy when we watch it over and over and over.Aside from entertaining songs, the video has an educational aspect as well, since the expertise of Steve and Terri Irwin is at hand to show us different animals and tell us what they're like.  Although I know my son doesn't understand that part right now, he has learned the names of some animals which appear in the video.This video also contains some nice extras: an interview with Steve, and some good outtakes at the end.Warning, though:  the songs will get lodged in your brain!
Title: N/A

reviewText: At first, I wasn't sure how my 21-month-old daughter would like this DVD, as it's quite a bit different from the Wiggles' television show.  However, she loves it!  It holds her attention even better than the TV show, and she sits as if in a trance when it's on.  This DVD is set outdoors, at the Australian Zoo, and features the Wiggles and the Steve Irwin family interacting with various animals.  The songs are probably the best of any of their videos-I find myself humming them alot!  Also featured are the four dancers (two men and two women) that appear in most of the Wiggles Dvds-they're such a pleasure to watch, and genuinely seem to be having fun.Overall, I highly recommend this DVD!  It's enjoyable for my daughter, and I enjoy it too!
summary: Catchy and captivating for both children and adults!
Title: N/A

reviewText: With a 2 year old daughter to chase around, the Wiggles have become a mainstay in my home.  They are a perfect distraction for my daughter when I have work that has to be done.  What makes this video so good is that it introduces American children to some of Australia's unique wildlife.  The Wiggles sing simple songs about koalas, dophins, cuckaburros(forgive the spelling), and even a song about snakes that warns "look, but you better not touch."  (Crocodile Hunter)Steve Irwin's energy is a perfect addition to the fray.  He explains simple things about the animals without going into too much detail for young minds.  Of course, it's the songs that really hold my daughter's attention.  Although she can't speak very well right now, she does manage to get a lot of the words to the songs right.  Most of the songs are very good, although a couple of them seem to drag a little bit compared to others.  Overall, this is a good video, and I highly recommend it.
summary: A Fine Entry in the Wiggly World
Title: N/A

reviewText: This film finds our heroes in the outback of their native Australia without a GPS in the Big Red Car. Fortunately, the much-missed Steve Irwin takes them along to check out the Australia Zoo (a good thing, since Anthony predictably ate all the food--who put him in charge of it, anyway?). Lots of great music and animal footage including a crazy disco performance of "Do the Owl" from one of the Wiggles' live shows. My two-year old digs the Wiggles to the max and this DVD is YET ANOTHER example of how children's videoes do not have to be annoying to be entertaining.

reviewText: My first reaction when I watched this show was that it was just okay. I didn't dislike it (like a couple other Wiggle's DVD I have tried) but I wasn't excited about it. The songs aren't too bad, but there is very little dancing on this one. My little girl (almost 2) is starting to pick up the moves from some of the other DVDs and this one would have given her little reason to get up and dance. I didn't like the live show segments at all (two). There is some good animal education, if that is what you are looking for. And, there were some fun scenes with the guys. This is one that I might get for her when she is older if she still likes the Wiggles, but for now there is too much talking and not enough dancing.
Title: N/A
